newsitem.title: USA: Most states on losing side of highway fund - study.
newsitem.headline: Most states on losing side of highway fund - study.

text.p: A new study of the federal Highway Trust Fund found that 33 states get back less than they contribute, the Reason Foundation said Monday.

The study, which adjusted contributions for lost interest and the costs of federal funding and regulation, found each state gets back only 83 percent of the nominal amount reported by the Federal Highway Administration.
The study "Defederalizing Transportation Funding," released by the Los Angeles-based foundation, also found that larger states were hit particularly hard.
California receives 66 percent of what it puts in, Michigan 56 percent, Ohio 64 percent, Florida 56 percent and Texas 58 percent, according to the study.
